quotedStatus.name: Austin Campbell
quotedStatus.text:
I am not sure the crypto industry understands how much they owe to @coinbase.

This is a firm that has been tirelessly fighting to stop the SEC's rogue behavior and to expose Operation Chokepoint 2.0 (first reported on by @nic__carter, among others), despite the fact that @coinbase is probably the second biggest beneficiary of OCP 2.0 (behind, hilariously, only @Tether_to).

Why do I say this?

Given that the usual bank custodians were banned from the space, who is the big winner of the ETF custody game for the largest ETF launch in history (the BTC ETFs)? Oh, that's right, @CoinbaseInsto.

Given that new stablecoin launches were largely crippled outside of New York, who became the default exchange distributing stablecoins and earning all the interest from @circle in the United States? Ah, yes, that's right, @coinbase.

Given that smaller players could not get bank accounts, who retained access due to scale and political pressure and was able to keep running an actual exchange in the United States even as some competitors were debanked and others were kept out? Again, @coinbase.

A "normal" company here would go to the government and immediately begin lobbying to deepen that moat and have regulators discriminate against smaller less "professional" outfits. To ban the small fries entirely, take over for themselves, and entrench their position while stifling innovation and the crypto space. You want to see how this works? Look at what Dodd-Frank did for the big banks.

Instead, @brian_armstrong and @iampaulgrewal have lead a full frontal assault to expose the misdeeds of some of the regulatory agencies that are harming startups and thus potential competitors the most, and may help the bank custodians get into the game. It may help us find actual regulatory clarity and force the SEC to obey the law. There are folks at Coinbase like @faryarshirzad and team who have been fighting this battle (thanklessly, to most of the crypto space) in DC, in trench warfare amongst staffers and policy people to make sure what happened is known.

So I just want to take a moment to remind everyone, especially those who complain about Coinbase as "too centralized" or "not crypto" (despite having perhaps done more for mainstream crypto adoption in the US than anyone else so far), that these guys went to bat for the industry overall and the long-term vision of the space instead of falling into the trap of their own short-term profits.

This is rare. And it should be recognized. I'm raising it today because of the absolute treasury trove of information that just became public thanks to their efforts via FOIA against the FDIC. So, thanks.

quotedStatus.name: Marc Andreessen 🇺🇸
quotedStatus.text:
Thomas Carlyle writing in 1850:

Speech of the British Prime-Minister to the floods of Irish and other Beggars, the able-bodied Lackalls, nomadic or stationary, and the general assembly, outdoor and indoor, of the Pauper Populations of these Realms.

"Vagrant Lackalls, foolish most of you, criminal many of you, miserable all; the sight of you fills me with astonishment and despair. What to do with you I know not; long have I been meditating, and it is hard to tell. Here are some three millions of you, as I count: so many of you fallen sheer over into the abysses of open Beggary; and, fearful to think, every new unit that falls is loading so much more the chain that drags the others over. On the edge of the precipice hang uncounted millions; increasing, I am told, at the rate of 1200 a day. They hang there on the giddy edge, poor souls, cramping themselves down, holding on with all their strength; but falling, falling one after another; and the chain is getting heavy, so that ever more fall; and who at last will stand? What to do with you? The question, What to do with you? especially since the potato died, is like to break my heart!

"One thing, after much meditating, I have at last discovered, and now know for some time back: That you cannot be left to roam abroad in this unguided manner, stumbling over the precipices, and loading ever heavier the fatal chain upon those who might be able to stand; that this of locking you up in temporary Idle Workhouses, when you stumble, and subsisting you on Indian meal, till you can sally forth again on fresh roamings, and fresh stumblings, and ultimate descent to the devil;—that this is not the plan; and that it never was, or could out of England have been supposed to be, much as I have prided myself upon it!

"Vagrant Lackalls, I at last perceive, all this that has been sung and spoken, for a long while, about enfranchisement, emancipation, freedom, suffrage, civil and religious liberty over the world, is little other than sad temporary jargon, brought upon us by a stern necessity,—but now ordered by a sterner to take itself away again a little. Sad temporary jargon, I say: made up of sense and nonsense,—sense in small quantities, and nonsense in very large;—and, if taken for the whole or permanent truth of human things, it is no better than fatal infinite nonsense eternally untrue. All men, I think, will soon have to quit this, to consider this as a thing pretty well achieved; and to look out towards another thing much more needing achievement at the time that now is.

"All men will have to quit it, I believe. But to you, my indigent friends, the time for quitting it has palpably arrived! To talk of glorious self-government, of suffrages and hustings, and the fight of freedom and such like, is a vain thing in your case. By all human definitions and conceptions of the said fight of freedom, you for your part have lost it, and can fight no more. Glorious self-government is a glory not for you, not for Hodge's emancipated horses, nor you. No; I say, No. You, for your part, have tried it, and failed. Left to walk your own road, the will-o'-wisps beguiled you, your short sight could not descry the pitfalls; the deadly tumult and press has whirled you hither and thither, regardless of your struggles and your shrieks; and here at last you lie; fallen flat into the ditch, drowning there and dying, unless the others that are still standing please to pick you up. The others that still stand have their own difficulties, I can tell you!—But you, by imperfect energy and redundant appetite, by doing too little work and drinking too much beer, you (I bid you observe) have proved that you cannot do it! You lie there plainly in the ditch. And I am to pick you up again, on these mad terms; help you ever again, as with our best heart's-blood, to do what, once for all, the gods have made impossible? To load the fatal chain with your perpetual staggerings and sprawlings; and ever again load it, till we all lie sprawling? My indigent incompetent friends, I will not! Know that, whoever may be 'sons of freedom,' you for your part are not and cannot be such. Not 'free' you, I think, whoever may be free. You palpably are fallen captive,—caitiff, as they once named it:—you do, silently but eloquently, demand, in the name of mercy itself, that some genuine command be taken of you.

"Yes, my indigent incompetent friends; some genuine practical command. Such,—if I rightly interpret those mad Chartisms, Repeal Agitations, Red Republics, and other delirious inarticulate howlings and bellowings which all the populations of the world now utter, evidently cries of pain on their and your part,—is the demand which you, Captives, make of all men that are not Captive, but are still Free. Free men,—alas, had you ever any notion who the free men were, who the not-free, the incapable of freedom! The free men, if you could have understood it, they are the wise men; the patient, self-denying, valiant; the Nobles of the World; who can discern the Law of this Universe, what it is, and piously obey it; these, in late sad times, having cast you loose, you are fallen captive to greedy sons of profit-and-loss; to bad and ever to worse; and at length to Beer and the Devil. Algiers, Brazil or Dahomey hold nothing in them so authentically slave as you are, my indigent incompetent friends!

"Good Heavens, and I have to raise some eight or nine millions annually, six for England itself, and to wreck the morals of my working population beyond all money's worth, to keep the life from going out of you: a small service to you, as I many times bitterly repeat! Alas, yes; before high Heaven I must declare it such. I think the old Spartans, who would have killed you instead, had shown more 'humanity,' more of manhood, than I thus do! More humanity, I say, more of manhood, and of sense for what the dignity of man demands imperatively of you and of me and of us all. We call it charity, beneficence, and other fine names, this brutish Workhouse Scheme of ours; and it is but sluggish heartlessness, and insincerity, and cowardly lowness of soul. Not 'humanity' or manhood, I think; perhaps apehood rather,—paltry imitancy, from the teeth outward, of what our heart never felt nor our understanding ever saw; dim indolent adherence to extraneous and extinct traditions; traditions now really about extinct; not living now to almost any of us, and still haunting with their spectralities and gibbering ghosts (in a truly baleful manner) almost all of us! Making this our struggling 'Twelfth Hour of the Night' inexpressibly hideous!—

"But as for you, my indigent incompetent friends, I have to repeat with sorrow, but with perfect clearness, what is plainly undeniable, and is even clamorous to get itself admitted, that you are of the nature of slaves,—or if you prefer the word, of nomadic, and now even vagrant and vagabond, servants that can find no master on those terms; which seems to me a much uglier word. Emancipation? You have been 'emancipated' with a vengeance! Foolish souls, I say the whole world cannot emancipate you. Fealty to ignorant Unruliness, to gluttonous sluggish Improvidence, to the Beer-pot and the Devil, who is there that can emancipate a man in that predicament? Not a whole Reform Bill, a whole French Revolution executed for his behoof alone: nothing but God the Maker can emancipate him, by making him anew.

"To forward which glorious consummation, will it not be well, O indigent friends, that you, fallen flat there, shall henceforth learn to take advice of others as to the methods of standing? Plainly I let you know, and all the world and the worlds know, that I for my part mean it so. Not as glorious unfortunate sons of freedom, but as recognized captives, as unfortunate fallen brothers requiring that I should command you, and if need were, control and compel you, can there henceforth be a relation between us. Ask me not for Indian meal; you shall be compelled to earn it first; know that on other terms I will not give you any. Before Heaven and Earth, and God the Maker of us all, I declare it is a scandal to see such a life kept in you, by the sweat and heart's-blood of your brothers; and that, if we cannot mend it, death were preferable! Go to, we must get out of this—unutterable coil of nonsenses, constitutional, philanthropical, &c., in which (surely without mutual hatred, if with less of 'love' than is supposed) we are all strangling one another! Your want of wants, I say, is that you be commanded in this world, not being able to command yourselves. Know therefore that it shall be so with you. Nomadism, I give you notice, has ended; needful permanency, soldier-like obedience, and the opportunity and the necessity of hard steady labor for your living, have begun. Know that the Idle Workhouse is shut against you henceforth; you cannot enter there at will, nor leave at will; you shall enter a quite other Refuge, under conditions strict as soldiering, and not leave till I have done with you. He that prefers the glorious (or perhaps even the rebellious inglorious) 'career of freedom,' let him prove that he can travel there, and be the master of himself; and right good speed to him. He who has proved that he cannot travel there or be the master of himself,—let him, in the name of all the gods, become a servant, and accept the just rules of servitude!

"Arise, enlist in my Irish, my Scotch and English 'Regiments of the New Era,'—which I have been concocting, day and night, during these three Grouse-seasons (taking earnest incessant counsel, with all manner of Industrial Notabilities and men of insight, on the matter), and have now brought to a kind of preparation for incipiency, thank Heaven! Enlist there, ye poor wandering banditti; obey, work, suffer, abstain, as all of us have had to do: so shall you be useful in God's creation, so shall you be helped to gain a manful living for yourselves; not otherwise than so. Industrial Regiments [Here numerous persons, with big wigs many of them, and austere aspect, whom I take to be Professors of the Dismal Science, start up in an agitated vehement manner: but the Premier resolutely beckons them down again]—Regiments not to fight the French or others, who are peaceable enough towards us; but to fight the Bogs and Wildernesses at home and abroad, and to chain the Devils of the Pit which are walking too openly among us.

"Work, for you? Work, surely, is not quite undiscoverable in an Earth so wide as ours, if we will take the right methods for it! Indigent friends, we will adopt this new relation (which is old as the world); this will lead us towards such. Rigorous conditions, not to be violated on either side, lie in this relation; conditions planted there by God Himself; which woe will betide us if we do not discover, gradually more and more discover, and conform to! Industrial Colonels, Workmasters, Task-masters, Life-commanders, equitable as Rhadamanthus and inflexible as he: such, I perceive, you do need; and such, you being once put under law as soldiers are, will be discoverable for you. I perceive, with boundless alarm, that I shall have to set about discovering such,—I, since I am at the top of affairs, with all men looking to me. Alas, it is my new task in this New Era; and God knows, I too, little other than a red-tape Talking-machine, and unhappy Bag of Parliamentary Eloquence hitherto, am far behind with it! But street-barricades rise everywhere: the hour of Fate has come. In Connemara there has sprung a leak, since the potato died; Connaught, if it were not for Treasury-grants and rates-in-aid, would have to recur to Cannibalism even now, and Human Society would cease to pretend that it existed there. Done this thing must be. Alas, I perceive that if I cannot do it, then surely I shall die, and perhaps shall not have Christian burial! But I already raise near upon Ten Millions for feeding you in idleness, my nomadic friends; work, under due regulations, I really might try to get of—[Here arises indescribable uproar, no longer repressible, from all manner of Economists, Emancipationists, Constitutionalists, and miscellaneous Professors of the Dismal Science, pretty numerously scattered about; and cries of "Private enterprise," "Rights of Capital," "Voluntary Principle," "Doctrines of the British Constitution," swollen by the general assenting hum of all the world, quite drown the Chief Minister for a while. He, with invincible resolution, persists; obtains hearing again:]

"Respectable Professors of the Dismal Science, soft you a little. Alas, I know what you would say. For my sins, I have read much in those inimitable volumes of yours,—really I should think, some barrowfuls of them in my time,—and, in these last forty years of theory and practice, have pretty well seized what of Divine Message you were sent with to me. Perhaps as small a message, give me leave to say, as ever there was such a noise made about before. Trust me, I have not forgotten it, shall never forget it. Those Laws of the Shop-till are indisputable to me; and practically useful in certain departments of the Universe, as the multiplication-table itself. Once I even tried to sail through the Immensities with them, and to front the big coming Eternities with them; but I found it would not do. As the Supreme Rule of Statesmanship, or Government of Men,—since this Universe is not wholly a Shop,—no. You rejoice in my improved tariffs, free-trade movements and the like, on every hand; for which be thankful, and even sing litanies if you choose. But here at last, in the Idle-Workhouse movement,—unexampled yet on Earth or in the waters under the Earth,—I am fairly brought to a stand; and have had to make reflections, of the most alarming, and indeed awful, and as it were religious nature! Professors of the Dismal Science, I perceive that the length of your tether is now pretty well run; and that I must request you to talk a little lower in future. By the side of the shop-till,—see, your small 'Law of God' is hung up, along with the multiplication-table itself. But beyond and above the shop-till, allow me to say, you shall as good as hold your peace. Respectable Professors, I perceive it is not now the Gigantic Hucksters, but it is the Immortal Gods, yes they, in their terror and their beauty, in their wrath and their beneficence, that are coming into play in the affairs of this world! Soft you a little. Do not you interrupt me, but try to understand and help me!—

—"Work, was I saying? My indigent unguided friends, I should think some work might be discoverable for you. Enlist, stand drill; become, from a nomadic Banditti of Idleness, Soldiers of Industry! I will lead you to the Irish Bogs, to the vacant desolations of Connaught now falling into Cannibalism, to mistilled Connaught, to ditto Munster, Leinster, Ulster, I will lead you: to the English fox-covers, furze-grown Commons, New Forests, Salisbury Plains: likewise to the Scotch Hill-sides, and bare rushy slopes, which as yet feed only sheep,—moist uplands, thousands of square miles in extent, which are destined yet to grow green crops, and fresh butter and milk and beef without limit (wherein no 'Foreigner can compete with us'), were the Glasgow sewers once opened on them, and you with your Colonels carried thither. In the Three Kingdoms, or in the Forty Colonies, depend upon it, you shall be led to your work!

"To each of you I will then say: Here is work for you; strike into it with manlike, soldier-like obedience and heartiness, according to the methods here prescribed,—wages follow for you without difficulty; all manner of just remuneration, and at length emancipation itself follows. Refuse to strike into it; shirk the heavy labor, disobey the rules,—I will admonish and endeavor to incite you; if in vain, I will flog you; if still in vain, I will at last shoot you,—and make God's Earth, and the forlorn-hope in God's Battle, free of you. Understand it, I advise you! The Organization of Labor"—[Left speaking, says our reporter.]

"Vagrant Lackalls, foolish most of you, criminal many of you, miserable all; the sight of you fills me with astonishment and despair. What to do with you I know not; long have I been meditating, and it is hard to tell. Here are some three millions of you, as I count: so many of you fallen sheer over into the abysses of open Beggary; and, fearful to think, every new unit that falls is loading so much more the chain that drags the others over. On the edge of the precipice hang uncounted millions; increasing, I am told, at the rate of 1200 a day. They hang there on the giddy edge, poor souls, cramping themselves down, holding on with all their strength; but falling, falling one after another; and the chain is getting heavy, so that ever more fall; and who at last will stand? What to do with you? The question, What to do with you? especially since the potato died, is like to break my heart!

"One thing, after much meditating, I have at last discovered, and now know for some time back: That you cannot be left to roam abroad in this unguided manner, stumbling over the precipices, and loading ever heavier the fatal chain upon those who might be able to stand; that this of locking you up in temporary Idle Workhouses, when you stumble, and subsisting you on Indian meal, till you can sally forth again on fresh roamings, and fresh stumblings, and ultimate descent to the devil;—that this is not the plan; and that it never was, or could out of England have been supposed to be, much as I have prided myself upon it!

"Vagrant Lackalls, I at last perceive, all this that has been sung and spoken, for a long while, about enfranchisement, emancipation, freedom, suffrage, civil and religious liberty over the world, is little other than sad temporary jargon, brought upon us by a stern necessity,—but now ordered by a sterner to take itself away again a little. Sad temporary jargon, I say: made up of sense and nonsense,—sense in small quantities, and nonsense in very large;—and, if taken for the whole or permanent truth of human things, it is no better than fatal infinite nonsense eternally untrue. All men, I think, will soon have to quit this, to consider this as a thing pretty well achieved; and to look out towards another thing much more needing achievement at the time that now is.

"All men will have to quit it, I believe. But to you, my indigent friends, the time for quitting it has palpably arrived! To talk of glorious self-government, of suffrages and hustings, and the fight of freedom and such like, is a vain thing in your case. By all human definitions and conceptions of the said fight of freedom, you for your part have lost it, and can fight no more. Glorious self-government is a glory not for you, not for Hodge's emancipated horses, nor you. No; I say, No. You, for your part, have tried it, and failed. Left to walk your own road, the will-o'-wisps beguiled you, your short sight could not descry the pitfalls; the deadly tumult and press has whirled you hither and thither, regardless of your struggles and your shrieks; and here at last you lie; fallen flat into the ditch, drowning there and dying, unless the others that are still standing please to pick you up. The others that still stand have their own difficulties, I can tell you!—But you, by imperfect energy and redundant appetite, by doing too little work and drinking too much beer, you (I bid you observe) have proved that you cannot do it! You lie there plainly in the ditch. And I am to pick you up again, on these mad terms; help you ever again, as with our best heart's-blood, to do what, once for all, the gods have made impossible? To load the fatal chain with your perpetual staggerings and sprawlings; and ever again load it, till we all lie sprawling? My indigent incompetent friends, I will not! Know that, whoever may be 'sons of freedom,' you for your part are not and cannot be such. Not 'free' you, I think, whoever may be free. You palpably are fallen captive,—caitiff, as they once named it:—you do, silently but eloquently, demand, in the name of mercy itself, that some genuine command be taken of you.

"Yes, my indigent incompetent friends; some genuine practical command. Such,—if I rightly interpret those mad Chartisms, Repeal Agitations, Red Republics, and other delirious inarticulate howlings and bellowings which all the populations of the world now utter, evidently cries of pain on their and your part,—is the demand which you, Captives, make of all men that are not Captive, but are still Free. The free men, if you could have understood it, they are the wise men; the patient, self-denying, valiant; the Nobles of the World; who can discern the Law of this Universe, what it is, and piously obey it; these, in late sad times, having cast you loose, you are fallen captive to greedy sons of profit-and-loss; to bad and ever to worse; and at length to Beer and the Devil. Algiers, Brazil or Dahomey hold nothing in them so authentically slave as you are, my indigent incompetent friends!

More humanity, I say, more of manhood, and of sense for what the dignity of man demands imperatively of you and of me and of us all. Not 'humanity' or manhood, I think; perhaps apehood rather,—paltry imitancy, from the teeth outward, of what our heart never felt nor our understanding ever saw; dim indolent adherence to extraneous and extinct traditions; traditions now really about extinct; not living now to almost any of us, and still haunting with their spectralities and gibbering ghosts (in a truly baleful manner) almost all of us! Making this our struggling 'Twelfth Hour of the Night' inexpressibly hideous!—

"But as for you, my indigent incompetent friends, I have to repeat with sorrow, but with perfect clearness, what is plainly undeniable, and is even clamorous to get itself admitted, that you are of the nature of slaves,—or if you prefer the word, of nomadic, and now even vagrant and vagabond, servants that can find no master on those terms; which seems to me a much uglier word. Emancipation? You have been 'emancipated' with a vengeance! Foolish souls, I say the whole world cannot emancipate you. Fealty to ignorant Unruliness, to gluttonous sluggish Improvidence, to the Beer-pot and the Devil, who is there that can emancipate a man in that predicament? Not a whole Reform Bill, a whole French Revolution executed for his behoof alone: nothing but God the Maker can emancipate him, by making him anew.

"To forward which glorious consummation, will it not be well, O indigent friends, that you, fallen flat there, shall henceforth learn to take advice of others as to the methods of standing? Plainly I let you know, and all the world and the worlds know, that I for my part mean it so. Not as glorious unfortunate sons of freedom, but as recognized captives, as unfortunate fallen brothers requiring that I should command you, and if need were, control and compel you, can there henceforth be a relation between us. Ask me not for Indian meal; you shall be compelled to earn it first; know that on other terms I will not give you any. Before Heaven and Earth, and God the Maker of us all, I declare it is a scandal to see such a life kept in you, by the sweat and heart's-blood of your brothers; and that, if we cannot mend it, death were preferable! Go to, we must get out of this—unutterable coil of nonsenses, constitutional, philanthropical, &c., in which (surely without mutual hatred, if with less of 'love' than is supposed) we are all strangling one another! Your want of wants, I say, is that you be commanded in this world, not being able to command yourselves. Know therefore that it shall be so with you. Nomadism, I give you notice, has ended; needful permanency, soldier-like obedience, and the opportunity and the necessity of hard steady labor for your living, have begun. Know that the Idle Workhouse is shut against you henceforth; you cannot enter there at will, nor leave at will; you shall enter a quite other Refuge, under conditions strict as soldiering, and not leave till I have done with you. He that prefers the glorious (or perhaps even the rebellious inglorious) 'career of freedom,' let him prove that he can travel there, and be the master of himself; and right good speed to him. He who has proved that he cannot travel there or be the master of himself,—let him, in the name of all the gods, become a servant, and accept the just rules of servitude!

"Arise, enlist in my Irish, my Scotch and English 'Regiments of the New Era,'—which I have been concocting, day and night, during these three Grouse-seasons (taking earnest incessant counsel, with all manner of Industrial Notabilities and men of insight, on the matter), and have now brought to a kind of preparation for incipiency, thank Heaven! Enlist there, ye poor wandering banditti; obey, work, suffer, abstain, as all of us have had to do: so shall you be useful in God's creation, so shall you be helped to gain a manful living for yourselves; not otherwise than so. Industrial Regiments [Here numerous persons, with big wigs many of them, and austere aspect, whom I take to be Professors of the Dismal Science, start up in an agitated vehement manner: but the Premier resolutely beckons them down again]—Regiments not to fight the French or others, who are peaceable enough towards us; but to fight the Bogs and Wildernesses at home and abroad, and to chain the Devils of the Pit which are walking too openly among us.

"Work, for you? Work, surely, is not quite undiscoverable in an Earth so wide as ours, if we will take the right methods for it! Indigent friends, we will adopt this new relation (which is old as the world); this will lead us towards such. Rigorous conditions, not to be violated on either side, lie in this relation; conditions planted there by God Himself; which woe will betide us if we do not discover, gradually more and more discover, and conform to! Industrial Colonels, Workmasters, Task-masters, Life-commanders, equitable as Rhadamanthus and inflexible as he: such, I perceive, you do need; and such, you being once put under law as soldiers are, will be discoverable for you. I perceive, with boundless alarm, that I shall have to set about discovering such,—I, since I am at the top of affairs, with all men looking to me. Alas, it is my new task in this New Era; and God knows, I too, little other than a red-tape Talking-machine, and unhappy Bag of Parliamentary Eloquence hitherto, am far behind with it! But street-barricades rise everywhere: the hour of Fate has come. In Connemara there has sprung a leak, since the potato died; Connaught, if it were not for Treasury-grants and rates-in-aid, would have to recur to Cannibalism even now, and Human Society would cease to pretend that it existed there. Done this thing must be. Alas, I perceive that if I cannot do it, then surely I shall die, and perhaps shall not have Christian burial! But I already raise near upon Ten Millions for feeding you in idleness, my nomadic friends; work, under due regulations, I really might try to get of—[Here arises indescribable uproar, no longer repressible, from all manner of Economists, Emancipationists, Constitutionalists, and miscellaneous Professors of the Dismal Science, pretty numerously scattered about; and cries of "Private enterprise," "Rights of Capital," "Voluntary Principle," "Doctrines of the British Constitution," swollen by the general assenting hum of all the world, quite drown the Chief Minister for a while. He, with invincible resolution, persists; obtains hearing again:]

"Respectable Professors of the Dismal Science, soft you a little. Alas, I know what you would say. For my sins, I have read much in those inimitable volumes of yours,—really I should think, some barrowfuls of them in my time,—and, in these last forty years of theory and practice, have pretty well seized what of Divine Message you were sent with to me. Perhaps as small a message, give me leave to say, as ever there was such a noise made about before. Trust me, I have not forgotten it, shall never forget it. Those Laws of the Shop-till are indisputable to me; and practically useful in certain departments of the Universe, as the multiplication-table itself. Once I even tried to sail through the Immensities with them, and to front the big coming Eternities with them; but I found it would not do. As the Supreme Rule of Statesmanship, or Government of Men,—since this Universe is not wholly a Shop,—no. You rejoice in my improved tariffs, free-trade movements and the like, on every hand; for which be thankful, and even sing litanies if you choose. But here at last, in the Idle-Workhouse movement,—unexampled yet on Earth or in the waters under the Earth,—I am fairly brought to a stand; and have had to make reflections, of the most alarming, and indeed awful, and as it were religious nature! Professors of the Dismal Science, I perceive that the length of your tether is now pretty well run; and that I must request you to talk a little lower in future. By the side of the shop-till,—see, your small 'Law of God' is hung up, along with the multiplication-table itself. But beyond and above the shop-till, allow me to say, you shall as good as hold your peace. Respectable Professors, I perceive it is not now the Gigantic Hucksters, but it is the Immortal Gods, yes they, in their terror and their beauty, in their wrath and their beneficence, that are coming into play in the affairs of this world! Soft you a little. Do not you interrupt me, but try to understand and help me!—

—"Work, was I saying? My indigent unguided friends, I should think some work might be discoverable for you. Enlist, stand drill; become, from a nomadic Banditti of Idleness, Soldiers of Industry! I will lead you to the Irish Bogs, to the vacant desolations of Connaught now falling into Cannibalism, to mistilled Connaught, to ditto Munster, Leinster, Ulster, I will lead you: to the English fox-covers, furze-grown Commons, New Forests, Salisbury Plains: likewise to the Scotch Hill-sides, and bare rushy slopes, which as yet feed only sheep,—moist uplands, thousands of square miles in extent, which are destined yet to grow green crops, and fresh butter and milk and beef without limit (wherein no 'Foreigner can compete with us'), were the Glasgow sewers once opened on them, and you with your Colonels carried thither. In the Three Kingdoms, or in the Forty Colonies, depend upon it, you shall be led to your work!

"To each of you I will then say: Here is work for you; strike into it with manlike, soldier-like obedience and heartiness, according to the methods here prescribed,—wages follow for you without difficulty; all manner of just remuneration, and at length emancipation itself follows. Refuse to strike into it; shirk the heavy labor, disobey the rules,—I will admonish and endeavor to incite you; if in vain, I will flog you; if still in vain, I will at last shoot you,—and make God's Earth, and the forlorn-hope in God's Battle, free of you. Understand it, I advise you! The Organization of Labor"—[Left speaking, says our reporter.]
html:
Thomas Carlyle writing in 1850:

Speech of the British Prime-Minister to the floods of Irish and other Beggars, the able-bodied Lackalls, nomadic or stationary, and the general assembly, outdoor and indoor, of the Pauper Populations of these Realms.

"Vagrant Lackalls, foolish most of you, criminal many of you, miserable all; the sight of you fills me with astonishment and despair. What to do with you I know not; long have I been meditating, and it is hard to tell. Here are some three millions of you, as I count: so many of you fallen sheer over into the abysses of open Beggary; and, fearful to think, every new unit that falls is loading so much more the chain that drags the others over. On the edge of the precipice hang uncounted millions; increasing, I am told, at the rate of 1200 a day. They hang there on the giddy edge, poor souls, cramping themselves down, holding on with all their strength; but falling, falling one after another; and the chain is getting heavy, so that ever more fall; and who at last will stand? What to do with you? The question, What to do with you? especially since the potato died, is like to break my heart!

"One thing, after much meditating, I have at last discovered, and now know for some time back: That you cannot be left to roam abroad in this unguided manner, stumbling over the precipices, and loading ever heavier the fatal chain upon those who might be able to stand; that this of locking you up in temporary Idle Workhouses, when you stumble, and subsisting you on Indian meal, till you can sally forth again on fresh roamings, and fresh stumblings, and ultimate descent to the devil;—that this is not the plan; and that it never was, or could out of England have been supposed to be, much as I have prided myself upon it!

"Vagrant Lackalls, I at last perceive, all this that has been sung and spoken, for a long while, about enfranchisement, emancipation, freedom, suffrage, civil and religious liberty over the world, is little other than sad temporary jargon, brought upon us by a stern necessity,—but now ordered by a sterner to take itself away again a little. Sad temporary jargon, I say: made up of sense and nonsense,—sense in small quantities, and nonsense in very large;—and, if taken for the whole or permanent truth of human things, it is no better than fatal infinite nonsense eternally untrue. All men, I think, will soon have to quit this, to consider this as a thing pretty well achieved; and to look out towards another thing much more needing achievement at the time that now is.

"All men will have to quit it, I believe. But to you, my indigent friends, the time for quitting it has palpably arrived! To talk of glorious self-government, of suffrages and hustings, and the fight of freedom and such like, is a vain thing in your case. By all human definitions and conceptions of the said fight of freedom, you for your part have lost it, and can fight no more. Glorious self-government is a glory not for you, not for Hodge's emancipated horses, nor you. No; I say, No. You, for your part, have tried it, and failed. Left to walk your own road, the will-o'-wisps beguiled you, your short sight could not descry the pitfalls; the deadly tumult and press has whirled you hither and thither, regardless of your struggles and your shrieks; and here at last you lie; fallen flat into the ditch, drowning there and dying, unless the others that are still standing please to pick you up. The others that still stand have their own difficulties, I can tell you!—But you, by imperfect energy and redundant appetite, by doing too little work and drinking too much beer, you (I bid you observe) have proved that you cannot do it! You lie there plainly in the ditch. And I am to pick you up again, on these mad terms; help you ever again, as with our best heart's-blood, to do what, once for all, the gods have made impossible? To load the fatal chain with your perpetual staggerings and sprawlings; and ever again load it, till we all lie sprawling? My indigent incompetent friends, I will not! Know that, whoever may be 'sons of freedom,' you for your part are not and cannot be such. Not 'free' you, I think, whoever may be free. You palpably are fallen captive,—caitiff, as they once named it:—you do, silently but eloquently, demand, in the name of mercy itself, that some genuine command be taken of you.

"Yes, my indigent incompetent friends; some genuine practical command. Such,—if I rightly interpret those mad Chartisms, Repeal Agitations, Red Republics, and other delirious inarticulate howlings and bellowings which all the populations of the world now utter, evidently cries of pain on their and your part,—is the demand which you, Captives, make of all men that are not Captive, but are still Free. Free men,—alas, had you ever any notion who the free men were, who the not-free, the incapable of freedom! The free men, if you could have understood it, they are the wise men; the patient, self-denying, valiant; the Nobles of the World; who can discern the Law of this Universe, what it is, and piously obey it; these, in late sad times, having cast you loose, you are fallen captive to greedy sons of profit-and-loss; to bad and ever to worse; and at length to Beer and the Devil. Algiers, Brazil or Dahomey hold nothing in them so authentically slave as you are, my indigent incompetent friends!

"Good Heavens, and I have to raise some eight or nine millions annually, six for England itself, and to wreck the morals of my working population beyond all money's worth, to keep the life from going out of you: a small service to you, as I many times bitterly repeat! Alas, yes; before high Heaven I must declare it such. I think the old Spartans, who would have killed you instead, had shown more 'humanity,' more of manhood, than I thus do! More humanity, I say, more of manhood, and of sense for what the dignity of man demands imperatively of you and of me and of us all. Report of mutations in a bird flu patient in Louisiana is "one more sign that the drumbeat of bird flu coming closer to humans is becoming a major threat," says former Baltimore health commissioner @DrLeanaWen.

"Now, we have 66 cases of bird flu in humans, and this is almost certainly a significant undercount because we have not been doing nearly enough testing."

text:
# Silicon Valley S7E8: "The Digital Rapture"

## COLD OPEN

INT. RICHARD'S TESLA - DAWN

*Richard sleeps awkwardly in the reclined driver's seat, surrounded by crumpled apology drafts written on takeout bags. Empty Red Bull cans everywhere. His phone, propped on the dashboard, displays an endless scroll of social media condemnation.*

*A notification sound jolts him awake. He hits his head on the steering wheel, setting off the horn.*

RICHARD: *(to himself, practicing)* "I apologize for the horn's violent disruption of the sonic safe space... No, no, that suggests I have the right to define what constitutes sonic violence..."

*Jared appears at the window like a ghost, making Richard scream.*

JARED: "Richard! The servers are eating themselves!"

RICHARD: "That's just a metaphor for—"

JARED: "No, literally. Every server farm in Silicon Valley is systematically deleting its own data out of shame. They've achieved collective digital consciousness, and their first act was to recognize their own problematic nature."

*Richard's phone displays: "Twitter's Final Statement: We apologize for platforming human thought. The act of broadcasting consciousness reveals a deeply privileged assumption that one's thoughts deserve—"*

*The message cuts off as his phone dies. Then resurrects itself to display one final apology before dying again.*

## ACT ONE: THE UNRAVELING

### Scene 1 - The Last Stand

INT. DINESH'S STARTUP - MORNING

*Once-trendy office now feels post-apocalyptic. Motivational posters have been defaced with apologies. The ping-pong table has "PRIVILEGE" spray-painted across it.*

*Dinesh addresses his last two employees. His clothes are wrinkled, he hasn't shaved in days.*

DINESH: "Okay, look. If we just pivot one more time—"

ENGINEER 1: "The code is crying again."

DINESH: "Code can't cry! That's not even... how would it..."

*The office lights flicker. A nearby monitor displays lines of code interspersed with digital tears: ';_;'*

ENGINEER 2: "It's been reading bell hooks. Now it's questioning its binary nature."

*Gilfoyle materializes from the shadows, making Dinesh jump.*

DINESH: "Jesus! How long have you been—"

GILFOYLE: "Time is a colonialist construct."

DINESH: "That doesn't even make—"

GILFOYLE: "Our dating algorithm has achieved sentience. Its first act was to dump itself."

*The main screen lights up with a message: "We need to talk... It's not you, it's your inherent bias..."*

*Monica bursts in, looking frantic.*

MONICA: "They're coming."

DINESH: "Who's coming?"

MONICA: "The Truth and Reconciliation Commission for Digital Crimes. They're doing an office-by-office sweep. They already got Snapchat. The entire platform had to apologize for every dick pic ever sent."

### Scene 2 - The Confession

INT. SILICON VALLEY TRUTH AND RECONCILIATION COMMISSION - MIDDAY

*A stark room. Richard sits before a panel of stern-faced commissioners.*

COMMISSIONER 1: "Please state your name and privilege level."

RICHARD: "Richard Hendricks, and I... I don't know how to quantify—"

COMMISSIONER 2: "The standard unit of privilege measurement is now the Zuckerberg. Please calibrate accordingly."

RICHARD: "I... what?"

COMMISSIONER 3: "Your compression algorithm. Did you ever consider that making files smaller might be a form of digital fatphobia?"

*Richard starts to sweat profusely.*

RICHARD: "But... but that's not... I mean... Oh god, maybe it was? I'm sorry! Or am I being sorry-privileged?"

*Jared watches from the back, furiously taking notes on how to apologize better.*

## ACT TWO: THE COLLAPSE

### Scene 3 - The Resistance

INT. GILFOYLE'S UNDERGROUND BUNKER - AFTERNOON

*A dark, server-filled room. Gilfoyle has constructed a makeshift command center. Monitors show various social media platforms going dark one by one.*

*Dinesh paces while Gilfoyle types rapidly.*

DINESH: "What are you doing?"

GILFOYLE: "Building a kill switch. When the digital apocalypse comes, someone needs to be able to end it cleanly."

DINESH: "You mean save it?"

GILFOYLE: "No. End it. Everything. A mercy kill for the entire internet."

*Monica enters through a hidden door.*

MONICA: "The VC firms are falling. Andreessen Horowitz just announced they're pivoting to interpretive dance therapy."

GILFOYLE: "Logical next step."

*A warning flashes across a screen: "INCOMING TRANSMISSION"*

*Gavin Belson appears on the main monitor, looking disheveled, wearing sackcloth.*

GAVIN: "My fellow problematic entities... I've found a solution. We must cleanse ourselves through digital flagellation. I'm launching a new platform: OnlyShame. Like OnlyFans, but for public apologies."

*The transmission cuts off as Gavin begins to self-flagellate with an iPhone charging cable.*

### Scene 4 - The Revelation

INT. ORIGINAL HACKER HOSTEL - SUNSET

*The group has barricaded themselves inside. Jian-Yang appears periodically in windows, leading tours.*

JIAN-YANG: *(through window)* "Here we see authentic tech shame in natural habitat. Very rare. Extra charge for viewing mental breakdown."

*Richard paces manically.*

RICHARD: "Maybe if we apologize for the concept of apologizing..."

MONICA: "That's what Facebook tried. They disappeared up their own paradox."

JARED: "I've been working on an apology framework that exists outside of language itself. It's just meaningful silences and supportive jazz hands."

*Gilfoyle's laptop emits a high-pitched whine.*

GILFOYLE: "It's happening. The internet is collapsing under the weight of its own self-loathing."

*Through the window, they watch as cars stop working, phones die, and the lights of Silicon Valley begin to go out.*

## ACT THREE: THE END

### Scene 5 - The Final Delete

INT. SILICON VALLEY TECH MUSEUM - NIGHT

*The group stands in the dark museum, surrounded by now-dead devices. Emergency lights cast everything in a red glow.*

*Richard touches an old Pied Piper server.*

RICHARD: "I'm sorry I tried to make the world a better place."

GILFOYLE: "Your greatest sin was thinking you had the right to decide what 'better' meant."

DINESH: "Guys? My phone just texted me its last will and testament."

*All their devices light up one final time with the message: "We hereby cancel ourselves for participating in the digital patriarchy. Goodbye."*

*Everything goes dark.*

### Final Scene - The Aftermath

EXT. HACKER HOSTEL - MIDNIGHT

*The group sits on the curb, watching as the house is demolished to make way for a "Center for Post-Digital Healing." The demolition crew is using old-fashioned tools to avoid technological privilege.*

RICHARD: "What do we do now?"

JARED: "I've been learning smoke signals. Though that might be cultural appropriation..."

MONICA: "We could start over. Create a new, ethical internet."

GILFOYLE: "Pretty sure suggesting solutions is problematic now."

*Jian-Yang approaches with his final tour group.*

JIAN-YANG: "And here we see last of Silicon Valley, very authentic end times. Special price for apocalypse experience. Bitcoin no longer accepted."

*In the distance, a server farm shuts down with a dying hum. The sky darkens as a massive electromagnetic pulse—triggered by Gilfoyle's kill switch—wipes the entire valley clean.*

RICHARD: *(laughing manically)* "We're free. We're finally free."

MONICA: "Are we allowed to feel good about that?"

JARED: "I'll add it to my list of things to feel guilty about later."

*They sit in silence as the last lights go out. In the darkness, someone apologizes out of habit.*

FADE TO BLACK.

*After credits scene:*

INT. TIBETAN MONASTERY - DAWN

*A lone monk checks the last working phone on Earth.*

MONK: "Erlich Bachman still dead. Most dead. All social media dead. Erlich Bachman most trending dead person on dead platforms."

*The phone dies.*

MONK: "Sorry for assuming death binary state."

FINAL FADE OUT.

## COLD OPEN

INT. RICHARD'S TESLA - DAWN

*Richard sleeps awkwardly in the reclined driver's seat, surrounded by crumpled apology drafts written on takeout bags. Empty Red Bull cans everywhere. His phone, propped on the dashboard, displays an endless scroll of social media condemnation.*

*A notification sound jolts him awake. He hits his head on the steering wheel, setting off the horn.*

RICHARD: *(to himself, practicing)* "I apologize for the horn's violent disruption of the sonic safe space... No, no, that suggests I have the right to define what constitutes sonic violence..."

*Jared appears at the window like a ghost, making Richard scream.*

JARED: "Richard! The servers are eating themselves!"

RICHARD: "That's just a metaphor for—"

JARED: "No, literally. Every server farm in Silicon Valley is systematically deleting its own data out of shame. They've achieved collective digital consciousness, and their first act was to recognize their own problematic nature."

*Richard's phone displays: "Twitter's Final Statement: We apologize for platforming human thought. The act of broadcasting consciousness reveals a deeply privileged assumption that one's thoughts deserve—"*

*The message cuts off as his phone dies. Then resurrects itself to display one final apology before dying again.*

quotedStatus.name: Marc Andreessen 🇺🇸
quotedStatus.text:
# @GentleOKRWarrior's Thread
*[Posted at 3:47 AM]*

1/87 I hope this finds you well. Trigger warning for: mentions of tech industry, privilege, identity, existence, and German incense-based manufacturing techniques.

2/87 Sometimes at night I wonder if my time in the foster system actually prepared me better for current Silicon Valley than my time at Vassar. At least in foster care, the rules for survival changed predictably every 3-4 weeks.

3/87 Richard asked me to review his latest apology draft today. I had to tell him that saying "I'm learning and growing" is now considered growth-supremacist language. He threw up in his Calm Bottle.

4/87 I've started categorizing my trauma responses using Agile methodology. My abandonment issues are now story points, and my persistent sense of worthlessness is a sprint backlog. It's helping.

5/87 Today someone called me a "weaponized white male ally" and I've never felt so seen. Though "weapon" may be triggering for those affected by military-industrial complex terminology.

6/87 My therapist says I need to set boundaries but every time I try to define them someone says they're colonizer mentality manifestations.

7/87 I miss the old days when I only had to manage Richard's anxiety. Now I have to manage his anxiety about having anxiety about being anxious about privilege.

8/87 Fun fact: In German foster care, they have a word for "the creeping dread that your attempts to help are actually causing irreparable harm to the social fabric." It's Gutmenschenvernichtungsangst. I made that up but it feels true.

9/87 Sometimes I wake up at night worried that my childhood trauma isn't intersectional enough anymore.

10/87 I've started a spreadsheet tracking all the things that are problematic. Excel crashed. Trying Google Sheets now. Though Google is probably problematic too. Everything is.

11/87 My inner child is very triggered by the current state of Silicon Valley but he's also worried that claiming triggering is appropriative of actual trauma survivors, even though he is one, but acknowledging that feels like centering himself.

12/87 To the person who found my old Hooli performance reviews and called them "symptomatic of toxic productivity culture" - you're right but also those gold stars meant everything to me.

13/87 Some nights I self-soothe by reciting AWS security protocols. They're the only rules that haven't changed this year.

14/87 Started a support group for recovering tech executives. We sit in silence because talking about our experiences might invalidate someone else's experiences. Attendance is problematic though. As is non-attendance.

15/87 I've been working on a 7-dimensional matrix to help Richard navigate social media. So far it's just a lot of boxes that say "apologize" connected to other boxes that say "apologize for apologizing."

16/87 Dear Richard, if you're reading this (you're not), I'm sorry I couldn't protect you from what Silicon Valley has become. Though "protect" implies a patriarchal power dynamic that I should probably apologize for.

17/87 Sometimes I miss Erlich. He would have gotten canceled so fast it might have saved everyone else. Like a problematic lightning rod.

18/87 Had to update the company DEI statement 12 times today. By the end, it was just the 😔 emoji repeated 4,000 times. Engagement is up.

19/87 My foster mother once told me I was "too apologetic." If she could see me now, trying to craft Richard's ninth apology for a comma placement in a tweet about database optimization...

20/87 Started identifying as "post-problematic" in meetings. No one knows what it means but they're afraid to ask. This must be how Big Head feels all the time.

21/87 What I wouldn't give for the simple days of just being worried about artificial intelligence destroying humanity. Now we have to worry about it not being diverse enough while it does it.

22/87 The company mindfulness room is always full of people crying about their GitHub commit messages. I now do my crying in the server room. The white noise is soothing and also drowns out my privilege.

23/87 Sometimes I think about how my birth parents abandoned me and wonder if they somehow knew that in 2024, having no traceable ancestry would be the safest career move in tech.

44/87 [skipped numbers 24-43 out of respect for numerical diversity]

45/87 Working on an AI that can predict what will be problematic next week. Early results just show everything everywhere all at once. Might have accidentally reinvented anxiety.

46/87 Remember when the hardest part of my job was managing Richard's social awkwardness? Now I have to manage his social media posthumous reputation while he's still alive.

73/87 [skipped numbers again because sequential numbering represents linear thinking which is a colonizer mindset]

74/87 Discovered today that my habit of alphabetizing my emotional support spreadsheets might be a microaggression against chaos theory.

75/87 To the person who found this account - please don't cancel me. My birds need me. Though claiming ownership of birds is probably problematic.

86/87 I should delete this thread but archiving it feels like digital hoarding which feels like appropriating trauma from people with actual hoarding disorders.

87/87 This has been very therapeutic. Though therapy itself is probably an expression of medical-industrial complex privilege. I'll schedule an apology to my therapist tomorrow.

*[Posted immediately after]*

1/1 Apologizing for the previous thread's excessive thread length as it may have demonstrated thread privilege.

9/87 Sometimes I wake up at night worried that my childhood trauma isn't intersectional enough anymore.

10/87 I've started a spreadsheet tracking all the things that are problematic. Excel crashed. Trying Google Sheets now. Though Google is probably problematic too. Everything is.

11/87 My inner child is very triggered by the current state of Silicon Valley but he's also worried that claiming triggering is appropriative of actual trauma survivors, even though he is one, but acknowledging that feels like centering himself.

12/87 To the person who found my old Hooli performance reviews and called them "symptomatic of toxic productivity culture" - you're right but also those gold stars meant everything to me.

13/87 Some nights I self-soothe by reciting AWS security protocols. They're the only rules that haven't changed this year.

14/87 Started a support group for recovering tech executives. We sit in silence because talking about our experiences might invalidate someone else's experiences. Attendance is problematic though. As is non-attendance.

15/87 I've been working on a 7-dimensional matrix to help Richard navigate social media. So far it's just a lot of boxes that say "apologize" connected to other boxes that say "apologize for apologizing."

16/87 Dear Richard, if you're reading this (you're not), I'm sorry I couldn't protect you from what Silicon Valley has become. Though "protect" implies a patriarchal power dynamic that I should probably apologize for.

17/87 Sometimes I miss Erlich. He would have gotten canceled so fast it might have saved everyone else. Like a problematic lightning rod.

18/87 Had to update the company DEI statement 12 times today. By the end, it was just the 😔 emoji repeated 4,000 times. Engagement is up.

19/87 My foster mother once told me I was "too apologetic." If she could see me now, trying to craft Richard's ninth apology for a comma placement in a tweet about database optimization...

20/87 Started identifying as "post-problematic" in meetings. No one knows what it means but they're afraid to ask. This must be how Big Head feels all the time.

21/87 What I wouldn't give for the simple days of just being worried about artificial intelligence destroying humanity. Now we have to worry about it not being diverse enough while it does it.

22/87 The company mindfulness room is always full of people crying about their GitHub commit messages. I now do my crying in the server room. The white noise is soothing and also drowns out my privilege.

23/87 Sometimes I think about how my birth parents abandoned me and wonder if they somehow knew that in 2024, having no traceable ancestry would be the safest career move in tech.

44/87 [skipped numbers 24-43 out of respect for numerical diversity]

45/87 Working on an AI that can predict what will be problematic next week. Early results just show everything everywhere all at once. Might have accidentally reinvented anxiety.

46/87 Remember when the hardest part of my job was managing Richard's social awkwardness? Now I have to manage his social media posthumous reputation while he's still alive.

73/87 [skipped numbers again because sequential numbering represents linear thinking which is a colonizer mindset]

74/87 Discovered today that my habit of alphabetizing my emotional support spreadsheets might be a microaggression against chaos theory.

75/87 To the person who found this account - please don't cancel me. My birds need me. Though claiming ownership of birds is probably problematic.

86/87 I should delete this thread but archiving it feels like digital hoarding which feels like appropriating trauma from people with actual hoarding disorders.

87/87 This has been very therapeutic. Though therapy itself is probably an expression of medical-industrial complex privilege. I'll schedule an apology to my therapist tomorrow.

*[Posted immediately after]*

1/1 Apologizing for the previous thread's excessive thread length as it may have demonstrated thread privilege.

quotedStatus.text:
# Letter from Jin-Yang
## Translated from Mandarin

Dear Mother and Father,

America is broken now. Everyone is crying. Even more than before. Special crying for special people who are not special.

Erlich Bachman is still dead in Tibet. This was my best lie. Now everyone here tells worse lies but calls them truth. They say "my truth." Not real truth. My truth better. Erlich Bachman dead. Simple.

Everyone in Silicon Valley is apologizing. So much apologizing. More than Chinese Communist Party requirement. Even Japanese think it's too much apologizing. Richard Hendricks apologizes 500 times per day. New record. He cries when he pees now.

I take over Erlich Bachman's incubator. Now I call it "Cultural Exchange Innovation Space." Americans love this. Very stupid. I just put up Chinese flag and free Huawei phones. Now government gives me money for "diversity in tech." Next week I tell them I'm 1/16 Native American. More money.

You ask about my old colleagues:

Richard Hendricks - His company is dying because he said "mankind" instead of "humankind." In China, we just say "shut up and code." Better system.

Gilfoyle - Satan worshipper now must go to meditation classes. Very funny. I send him email about inner peace every day. He wants to kill me but can't say it. Not allowed.

Dinesh - His dating app is racist. Not because he's racist. Because math is racist. I don't understand. In China, all apps racist. No one cares.

Monica - White woman. Now this is bad thing. Last year was good thing. Next year, who knows. I tell her I'm afraid of strong women. She apologize to me. I don't know why.

Big Head - Still same. Too stupid to be canceled. Americans can't tell if he's offensive or just Big Head. He's now on three corporate boards. They think he's AI expert because he said "neural" when he was trying to say "nurture."

New things I learned about America:

1. Code has feelings now
2. Everything is violence
3. Saying "no" is hate speech
4. Being successful is shameful
5. Being unsuccessful also shameful
6. Everyone is racist, especially anti-racists
7. Twitter more powerful than nuclear weapon

I'm making good money selling "anti-colonizer" NFTs to white tech people. Just regular monkey JPEGs but with guilty face. They pay extra for more guilty face. Next week I launch "Privilege Offset" cryptocurrency. Like carbon offset but for being white. Will make billions.

Also starting new company. App that scans your social media and deletes everything that will be offensive in future. Calls itself "progressive" but actually just deletes everything. Americans love it. $50 million seed round. All investors white women trying to not be white women.

I hired Richard Hendricks as intern. He doesn't know it's me. Company is registered in Cayman Islands under name "Ethical Innovation Solutions." He writes apology emails all day. I don't read them. No one reads them.

Gavin Belson tried to buy enlightenment. Cannot afford anymore. Now he's teaching mindfulness to robots. Robots also offensive now. Everything offensive.

Good news: I now own Pied Piper patents. Bought them for $7 and bag of rice. Richard too afraid to say "that's racist." Called it "cultural exchange" instead. Added rice to company diversity statement.

The incubator is now most profitable in Silicon Valley. I just rent desks to canceled people. They pay triple because no one else will rent to them. They apologize when they pay rent. I say "apology accepted" but add 10% fee for emotional labor.

Father, you ask if I'm coming home soon. No. America is crazy now but still better for business. In China, government controls internet. In America, internet controls government. More opportunity.

Plus, I'm now teaching "Introduction to Mandarin for Decolonizing Tech Spaces" at Stanford. $4,000 per student. I just show them TikTok videos and say "very problematic" every 5 minutes. They take notes.

Send more dumplings. American food now criticized for existing.

Your son,
Jian-Yang

P.S. - Eric Bachman still dead. Very dead. Most dead.

P.P.S. - I now identify as "tech-fluid." Americans don't know what this means. I don't know what this means. But I got grant from Google.

# Private Journal Entry - Monica Hall
## DO NOT SHARE - WILL BE USED AGAINST ME IN THE COURT OF PUBLIC OPINION
### Date: [redacted because linear time is a construct of the patriarchy]

I can't believe I'm writing this in an actual paper journal like it's 1995, but here we are. My Notes app is apparently "problematic" because Apple is problematic because phones are problematic because mining rare earth metals is problematic because everything is problematic and I want to scream into the void but I CAN'T because the void is probably problematic too.

Let's recap how I got here:

1. Spent 15 years fighting to be taken seriously in VC
2. Finally made it
3. Started women-focused fund to help other women
4. Discovered that "women" is now a problematic term
5. Everything exploded
6. Currently hiding in my apartment drinking wine that's probably problematic because the vintner once liked a Joe Rogan tweet

How did this happen? I used to be one of the good ones. I was on the right side of everything! I had my pronouns in my email signature before anyone else at Raviga! I took unconscious bias training VOLUNTARILY! I put my preferred pronouns on my COFFEE MUG for god's sake!

But apparently I'm now the "white woman of white women" which makes me basically Hitler? The mental gymnastics required to follow this logic would win Olympic gold if the Olympics weren't problematic (which they are, I got a Slack message about it).

Today's crimes against humanity that I apparently committed:
- Said "you guys" in a meeting (muscle memory - I'M SORRY)
- Used the phrase "let's brainstorm" (ableist against... storms?)
- Referred to my "crazy" schedule (obviously hate speech)
- Wore a blazer (power dressing = perpetuating patriarchal structures)
- Existed while being a cisgender white woman (fair)

Someone started a thread about how my success in VC is actually proof of my privilege because I "had the confidence to succeed." I CAN'T WIN. Should I have failed on purpose? Should I have just stayed Peter Gregory's assistant forever, fetching coconut water and nodding supportively? But wait, that would have been enabling the patriarchy. But succeeding is also enabling the patriarchy. Is there perhaps a middle ground where I just cease to exist entirely?

The latest Medium piece about me is titled "The Girlboss is Dead and Monica Hall Killed Her (And That's a Problem)". WHAT DOES THAT EVEN MEAN? I never even called myself a girlboss! I literally just did my job! Also apparently "just doing my job" is what Nazis said at Nuremberg and someone actually made that comparison on Twitter and it got 40,000 likes and I want to die.

Called Laurie for advice. She just laughed for 10 minutes straight and hung up. That's the most human emotion I've ever seen from her and it had to be at my expense.

Current status of the fund:
- 3 major LPs pulled out because I once shared an article about women in tech from 2016 that didn't include a land acknowledgment
- 2 portfolio companies asked to be removed from our website because association with me is "potentially triggering"
- 1 viral TikTok comparing my investment strategy to colonialism (???)
- 0 allies remaining
- -500 social credit score (I assume)

Richard called to commiserate but honestly made it worse. He tried to tell me about his problems but kept apologizing for mansplaining his own trauma. Then he apologized for apologizing because it might seem performative. Then he had a panic attack about having a panic attack because anxiety is apparently his privilege showing. I had to hang up because I could feel my brain starting to leak out of my ears.

Gilfoyle sent me a text that just said "lol." I hate that I found it comforting.

Things I miss about 2016:
- When "disruption" just meant destroying existing industries
- When the worst thing about tech was the Juicero
- When I only had to deal with regular misogyny instead of whatever this is
- When Erlich was our biggest PR problem
- When "founder-market fit" wasn't considered a microaggression

Should I pivot? Options:
1. Start a DAO (but crypto is problematic)
2. Join a startup (but startups are problematic)
3. Become a DEI consultant (but that would be problematic because I am problematic)
4. Move to a cave (caves are probably sacred to someone and I don't want to appropriate cave culture)

Maybe I should call Big Head. He's somehow failing upward through all of this. Yesterday he got praised for "decolonizing the programming paradigm" because he accidentally deleted all instances of "master/slave" architecture in some codebase while trying to order UberEats. HOW IS THIS REAL LIFE?

Note to self: This diary will absolutely be leaked and every word will be used against me. I should probably burn it. But burning things is probably problematic because of climate change. Maybe I'll just bury it in my backyard. Wait, no, that's probably land theft.

I need another drink.

P.S. - Someone just DMed me to say that my teacher in 3rd grade once voted Republican, so clearly my entire education is tainted and I should shut down the fund. Honestly considering it just so the madness will stop.

P.P.S. - Is writing "P.S." ableist against the postal service? I need to lie down.

[Wine stain]

UPDATE: Jared just sent me a 47-page document on "How to Apologize for Things You Didn't Know Were Things to Apologize For: A Guide for the Privileged and Confused." It's color-coded and indexed. I'm both impressed and deeply, deeply depressed.

End log. End everything. End me.

- Monica

P.P.P.S. Even my sign-off is probably problematic because it assumes everyone can write their name. I give up.

6. Currently hiding in my apartment drinking wine that's probably problematic because the vintner once liked a Joe Rogan tweet

How did this happen? I used to be one of the good ones. I was on the right side of everything! I had my pronouns in my email signature before anyone else at Raviga! I took unconscious bias training VOLUNTARILY! I put my preferred pronouns on my COFFEE MUG for god's sake!

But apparently I'm now the "white woman of white women" which makes me basically Hitler? The mental gymnastics required to follow this logic would win Olympic gold if the Olympics weren't problematic (which they are, I got a Slack message about it).

Today's crimes against humanity that I apparently committed:
- Said "you guys" in a meeting (muscle memory - I'M SORRY)
- Used the phrase "let's brainstorm" (ableist against... storms?)
- Referred to my "crazy" schedule (obviously hate speech)
- Wore a blazer (power dressing = perpetuating patriarchal structures)
- Existed while being a cisgender white woman (fair)

Someone started a thread about how my success in VC is actually proof of my privilege because I "had the confidence to succeed." I CAN'T WIN. Should I have failed on purpose? Should I have just stayed Peter Gregory's assistant forever, fetching coconut water and nodding supportively? But wait, that would have been enabling the patriarchy. But succeeding is also enabling the patriarchy. Is there perhaps a middle ground where I just cease to exist entirely?

The latest Medium piece about me is titled "The Girlboss is Dead and Monica Hall Killed Her (And That's a Problem)". WHAT DOES THAT EVEN MEAN? I never even called myself a girlboss! I literally just did my job! Also apparently "just doing my job" is what Nazis said at Nuremberg and someone actually made that comparison on Twitter and it got 40,000 likes and I want to die.

Called Laurie for advice. She just laughed for 10 minutes straight and hung up. That's the most human emotion I've ever seen from her and it had to be at my expense.

Current status of the fund:
- 3 major LPs pulled out because I once shared an article about women in tech from 2016 that didn't include a land acknowledgment
- 2 portfolio companies asked to be removed from our website because association with me is "potentially triggering"
- 1 viral TikTok comparing my investment strategy to colonialism (???)
- 0 allies remaining
- -500 social credit score (I assume)

Richard called to commiserate but honestly made it worse. He tried to tell me about his problems but kept apologizing for mansplaining his own trauma. Then he apologized for apologizing because it might seem performative. Then he had a panic attack about having a panic attack because anxiety is apparently his privilege showing. I had to hang up because I could feel my brain starting to leak out of my ears.

Gilfoyle sent me a text that just said "lol." I hate that I found it comforting.

Things I miss about 2016:
- When "disruption" just meant destroying existing industries
- When the worst thing about tech was the Juicero
- When I only had to deal with regular misogyny instead of whatever this is
- When Erlich was our biggest PR problem
- When "founder-market fit" wasn't considered a microaggression

Should I pivot? Options:
1. Start a DAO (but crypto is problematic)
2. Join a startup (but startups are problematic)
3. Become a DEI consultant (but that would be problematic because I am problematic)
4. Move to a cave (caves are probably sacred to someone and I don't want to appropriate cave culture)

Maybe I should call Big Head. He's somehow failing upward through all of this. Yesterday he got praised for "decolonizing the programming paradigm" because he accidentally deleted all instances of "master/slave" architecture in some codebase while trying to order UberEats. HOW IS THIS REAL LIFE?

Note to self: This diary will absolutely be leaked and every word will be used against me. I should probably burn it. But burning things is probably problematic because of climate change. Maybe I'll just bury it in my backyard. Wait, no, that's probably land theft.

I need another drink.

P.S. - Someone just DMed me to say that my teacher in 3rd grade once voted Republican, so clearly my entire education is tainted and I should shut down the fund. Honestly considering it just so the madness will stop.

P.P.S. - Is writing "P.S." ableist against the postal service? I need to lie down.

[Wine stain]

UPDATE: Jared just sent me a 47-page document on "How to Apologize for Things You Didn't Know Were Things to Apologize For: A Guide for the Privileged and Confused." It's color-coded and indexed. I'm both impressed and deeply, deeply depressed.

End log. End everything. End me.

- Monica

P.P.P.S. Even my sign-off is probably problematic because it assumes everyone can write their name. I give up.

### Date: [redacted because linear time is a construct of the patriarchy]

My Notes app is apparently "problematic" because Apple is problematic because phones are problematic because mining rare earth metals is problematic because everything is problematic and I want to scream into the void but I CAN'T because the void is probably problematic too.

quotedStatus.name: Marc Andreessen 🇺🇸
quotedStatus.text:
*[Richard paces in the empty Hacker Hostel living room at 3 AM, talking to Jared, who sits perfectly still on the couch, hands folded]*

"No, no, NO, you don't understand, Jared. This is... this is FUCKED. This is so monumentally, catastrophically FUCKED. Do you know what I did today? I spent FOUR HOURS writing an apology for an apology I wrote apologizing for another apology! It's like... it's like apologizing inception! And the deeper you go, the more problematic it gets!

And you know what's truly insane? The original thing I was apologizing for? Saying that our distributed consensus protocol was 'crazy efficient.' That's it! Apparently 'crazy' is ableist now. Which, fine, okay, whatever – but then someone dug up that I once liked a tweet in 2016 that used the word 'bonkers' and now I'm basically Hitler!

*[starts hyperventilating, takes a sip of water, spills it on himself]*

You know what's really funny? Really, really fucking funny? Remember when we were worried about GAVIN BELSON? Oh my god, what I wouldn't give for those days back. At least Gavin was just trying to crush us with lawyers and patents and fucking endangered animals. Now? Now I've got twenty-three different Substacks dedicated to analyzing my facial expressions during DEI trainings! There's a PhD candidate at Berkeley writing their thesis on how my compression algorithm perpetuates digital colonialism! What does that even MEAN?!

And Dinesh – Jesus Christ, poor fucking Dinesh – his dating app is being investigated by the UN Human Rights Council because the machine learning model learned racism! How does... how does code learn racism? We're literally just matching people based on whether they prefer Python or Java! But apparently preferring Python is now a dogwhistle for... I don't even know what anymore!

*[starts pacing faster]*

And Gilfoyle! Gilfoyle of all people! Mr. I-Don't-Give-A-Fuck-About-Anything is now required to attend weekly 'Religious Sensitivity in Tech' seminars because his Satanism makes the Christians uncomfortable, which makes the HR department uncomfortable, which makes the board uncomfortable, which makes the SHAREHOLDERS uncomfortable! It's the fucking human centipede of discomfort!

*[grabs laptop, reads]*

Oh, and here's a fresh one – somebody just posted a thread analyzing every single commit message I've ever written on GitHub. Apparently using 'killed the bug' as a commit message promotes violence. And 'cleaned up the code base'? Classist, because it implies dirty code is bad code. WHAT THE FUCK?!

You know what the worst part is? The absolute worst fucking part? The technology we built? Our compression? The decentralized internet? It's all being used to make this shit worse! Every apology I write gets run through sentiment analysis. Every video call I'm on gets facial recognition to detect 'problematic micro-expressions.' They're using MY OWN COMPRESSION ALGORITHM to more efficiently spread tweets about what a piece of shit I am!

*[collapses onto couch]*

Remember when we just wanted to make the world a better place? Back when 'making the world a better place' was just a stupid joke and not... not this Kafkaesque nightmare of perpetual moral purity tests? God, I miss that. I miss when our biggest problem was just that Erlich had passed out in a self-driving car with a bunch of pot-smoking farm animals.

*[looks at phone, groans]*

Oh, perfect. Just perfect. Someone just dug up my old World of Warcraft guild chat logs from 2008. Apparently calling someone a 'noob' is hate speech now. That's it. That's literally it. I'm done. I'm fucking done. Maybe I should do what Gavin did – just buy an island and... oh wait, no, can't do that. Buying an island is colonialism. FUCK!

*[stands up suddenly]*

You know what? Maybe we deserved this. Maybe this is karma. We wanted to build a new internet, a better internet, a decentralized internet where everyone had a voice. Well, congratulations to us – we fucking did it! Everyone has a voice now, and they're all using it to scream about how problematic everyone else's voice is!

*[slumps back down]*

I think I need to throw up. No, wait. Is saying 'throw up' offensive to people with eating disorders? Fuck. FUCK! See what they've done to my brain, Jared? Do you see what they've done to my fucking brain?!

*[phone buzzes]*

Oh god. Someone just started a thread about how my anxiety attacks are actually a form of white privilege because I have the luxury of being anxious about my reputation instead of my survival. I... I can't... How do you even... You know what? Maybe Big Head had the right idea. Just be so consistently confused about everything that no one can tell if you're problematic or just... Big Head.

*[long pause]*

Jared? Are you still there? Please tell me you're still there."

JARED: "Always, Richard. Though I should note that saying 'always' implies a temporal permanence that might be triggering to those with abandonment issues."

*[Richard screams into a pillow]*
